channel.title: How do i change the ip of a client?
channel.description:
Hello guys, well the problem is the following: I downloaded a client base, but it has no ip changer on the user and pass screen, so i'd like to change the server ip to mine..but dunno which file i have to edit..please explain me..thanks.
PD: I already searched on moparscape forums by search bar and didn't find anything useful..

item.title: How do i change the ip of a client?
item.dc:creator: @pus pus
item.description:
@pus wrote:

In the GUI file you will see this

public class EGUI {
public static void main(String args[]) {
client.main(
new String[] {
“”, “”,
“”

Then change it to this

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“127.0.0.1”, “127.0.0.1”, “127.0.0.1”
});
}
}

and on the compiler . Right click on it and click on edit and paste this in

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is
about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/…
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

item.description:
@pus wrote:

[quote=“facundo, post:5, topic:306037”]Thank you so much:)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 03, 2009, 03:29:14 pm[/size][hr]Sorry for double post but i have another prblem: i want to put for example this ip in the following:
Ip: 127.0.0.1 how do i put that ip on this:

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI {
public static void main(String args[]) {
client.main(
new String[] {
“”, “”,
“”
});
}
}

and also the compiler of the client doesn’t work :S[/quote]

No problem : )

item.title: How do i change the ip of a client?
item.dc:creator: @pus pus
item.description:
@pus wrote:

Go to your client and find Frame_Sub1.java then you will see

import java.awt.*;
import sign.signlink;

public final class Frame_Sub1 extends Frame
{

public Frame_Sub1(Applet_Sub1 applet_sub1, int i, byte byte0, int j)
{
    aBoolean35 = true;
    anApplet_Sub1_36 = applet_sub1;
    setTitle("317 client");
    setResizable(false);
    show();
    if(byte0 != 5)
        aBoolean35 = !aBoolean35;
    toFront();
    resize(i + 8, j + 28);
}

public Graphics getGraphics()
{
    Graphics g = super.getGraphics();
    g.translate(4, 24);
    return g;
}

public final void update(Graphics g)
{
    anApplet_Sub1_36.update(g);
}

public final void paint(Graphics g)
{
    anApplet_Sub1_36.paint(g);
}
public String aString323_Sub9242()
{
 return client.method993277();
}

private boolean aBoolean35;
Applet_Sub1 anApplet_Sub1_36;

}

And then you will see setTitle(“317 client”); change it to what ever you want : )

item.title: How do i change the ip of a client?
item.dc:creator: @duffy12345678910 duffy12345678910
item.description:
@duffy12345678910 wrote:

go into the egui.java in your client folder there you will se something like this
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“iphere”, “iphere”, “iphere”
});
}
}
